content.question:
Two cylindrical rods, Rod <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Rod <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, have resistances of <math alttext="uppercase R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Rod <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has length <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, cross-sectional radius <math alttext="lowercase r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and is made from a material with resistivity <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. For which of the following combinations of length, cross-sectional radius, and resistivity for Rod <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is it possible for <math alttext="uppercase R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to be equal to <math alttext="uppercase R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?
LengthCross-sectional RadiusResistivityAGreater than <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Greater than <math alttext="lowercase r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Equal to <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>BGreater than <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Less than <math alttext="lowercase r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Greater than <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>CEqual to <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Less than <math alttext="lowercase r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Greater than <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>DLess than <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Equal to <math alttext="lowercase r sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Less than <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
